utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I’m glad you’re here, we have a couple of things to ask you about the wedding ceremony.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What’s the matter? You okay?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s just y’know…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Monica said wedding.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Uh, so anyway, we thought one of you could read something during the ceremony.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh! I would love to read a poem.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Do you think you could get through a poem?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: It’ll be a short one.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, so Ross will be doing the reading.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohhh…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay. Yeah, I guess, I guess I could do that too.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Too?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, I kind of uh, have something else planned for you guys.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Do you mind telling us what it is?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Sorry, I’m kinda keeping this one on the Q.T.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, whatever it is, I hope it involves winking.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So I just talked to one of the DOOL writers today, and…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What is DOOL?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Days Of Our Lives. Anyway, you’re not gonna believe it! My character is coming out of his coma!!

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Oh!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That’s great!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: And-and-and not only that, I’m gettin’ a new brain!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So great things are happening at work and in your personal life!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wait, what do you mean you’re getting a new brain?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh well, they’re killing off one of the characters on the show, and when she dies her brain is being transplanted into my body.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What? A brain transplant?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yes, it’s a highly controversial procedure.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It’s ridiculous!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, I think it’s ridiculous that you haven’t had sex in three and a half months.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It’s winter, they are fewer people on the street.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Who are they killing off?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Uh Cecilia Monroe, she plays Jessica Lockhart.

utterance.speaker: Rachel and Monica
utterance.content: Noo!!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: She’s my favorite character on DOOL.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Nice.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: She is so good at throwing drinks in people’s faces, I mean I don’t think I’ve ever seen her finish a beverage.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: And the way she slaps all the time!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wouldn’t you love to do it just once?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Don’t do it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Cecilia Monroe man, what a great actress.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, tell me about it. And she’s been on the show forever, it’s gonna be really hard to fill her shoes.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah-yeah, help me out here, when you come out of the "brain transplant," you are going to be her?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yes, but in Drake Remoray’s body. Why is this so hard for you to get? I thought you were a scientist!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Rach, so, that guy there. Straight or gay?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, I'd have to say gay.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah? Why?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well mainly because he's kissing that other guy.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh no not that guy there. That guy right there.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh yeah he's too cute to be straight.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ohh knockers will help us figure it out.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right, straight, and not subtle.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ohh, he left his cell phone.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, well, we can hand it to Gunther and he'll put it in lost and found.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Or we could use it to call China. See how those guys are doing.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What if, um, if he calls his own cell phone to find out who found it and I answer and we start talking and we fell in love. I mean wouldn't that be a great story? Kind of like a fairy tale for the digital age.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah… That does sound great. I'm going to get the phone.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What? Wait! Why…why do you get the story?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I don't know. I haven't been out on a date in so long.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Phoebe, you had a date three days ago.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That wasn’t a date! That was, that was just friends getting together… having sex.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay. Okay, see? I get the phone.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No way! No way! You just broke with Tag a week ago.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah! And until now, I didn’t think I’d love again.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Nice try.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh hey-hey wait! How do we fairly decide who gets the phone?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well umm, maybe we could uhh… Ah-ha! Too slow!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ah-ha! Too cocky!

utterance.speaker: Dina
utterance.content: I’m going to keep dating him Mother, and there’s nothing you can do about it!

utterance.speaker: Jessica Lockhart
utterance.content: Oh yes there is!

utterance.speaker: Dina
utterance.content: What are you going to do? Kill him? Like you did with Charles?!

utterance.speaker: Jessica Lockhart
utterance.content: That was an accident! And so were you.

utterance.speaker: Dina
utterance.content: Well, at least I’m not a murderer!

utterance.speaker: Jessica Lockhart
utterance.content: Oh, my baby!

utterance.speaker: The Director
utterance.content: Cut!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That was a great scene! And-and-and that slap looks so real! How do you do that?

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: Oh, just years of experience.

utterance.speaker: Dina
utterance.content: Can I get some ice here?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh anyway, I just wanted to say how wonderful I think you are.

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: You’re not the fan who’s dying are you?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Say what?

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: I’m supposed to meet and hug a fan whose dying, but that’s not supposed to be until later!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No. No, I’m Joey Tribbiani; we did a scene together yesterday. I-I’m the guy in the coma!

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: Oh that was a real person?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: An-an-anyway I-I just wanted to say that since I’m getting your brain when you leave the show, I was wondering if there was any tips you can give me…

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: I-I-I’m leaving the show?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I don’t know. Why? Did you hear something?

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: Who told you that?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh uh, one of the writers.

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: Which one? Was it bald or was it tall?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Umm…

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: Y’know what? It doesn’t matter! Because it is not true!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: And if it were true, how dare you come to me ask me for tips about a character that I’ve been playing for 20 years—I’ll give you a tip!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ms. Monroe… Oh there you go.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No Phoebe! You cannot get the phone that way; that’s not fair! Okay look, I have an idea. Why don’t we, why don’t we see what kind of number he has on his speed dial, and then from that we can tell who has more in common with him. And then whoever does gets the phone.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Or, we can decide by whose ever name is closer to the word phone.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I don’t think so.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Fine all right, but I’d bet you’d be singing another tune if we were fighting over a ratchet.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right, first name on the speed dial is mom.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ohh, I lost my mom to suicide.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay no way, you cannot use that to get the cute guy and the last blueberry muffin.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Did I use that already today? I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes okay. Well now see this isn’t telling us anything. Joe. Carlos. Peter. Ooh! Peter Luger! T hat’s a steak house!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, a meat eater. Fine, that’s one for you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, I win! He’s got Barney’s on his speed dial.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So you don’t know that’s Barney’s the store! That can be y’know his friend’s house, or a bar. Who has Barney’s the store on their speed dial?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: His new girlfriend!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What is that?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I think it’s the dying cat parade.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It sounds like it’s coming from across the street.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Y’know that thing that Ross was gonna do at our wedding?! He was hanging out with me yesterday and he turned to me and said, "You’re half Scottish right?"

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Nooo!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes!!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No, there is no way! It can not be Ross! Unbelievable! Why is your family Scottish?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Why is your family Ross?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: He cannot play at our wedding! I mean everyone will leave! I mean come on, that is just noise! It’s not even a song!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: If you listen very carefully, I think its Celebration by Cool and the Gang.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi Pheebs!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: How are ya?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Good.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Umm Pheebs, remember when we were in the coffee house we decided that I was going to keep the uh, the cute guy’s cell phone?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And remember how I said I was going to keep it in my purse so that if it rang I could just pick it up?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And do you remember going into my purse and stealing the phone?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooh, now you lost me.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You stole the phone!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No I didn’t!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No? So you’re saying that if I called it, it wouldn’t ring?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Umm, okay. But while you dial, let me show you the features of my new ringing handbag. Oh, it does work!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Phoebe!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That is a different phone.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh is it?! Uhh, hello? Yes hi, is Rachel there? Yes she is, just one moment please. It’s for me!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That is damning evidence.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my God! I bet that’s him. My digital fairy tale is about to begin. I wonder how I should be? Should I be uh Hello? Or should I be Hi! It’s Rach… Would you stop doing that?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hello? Yes, I’m the one who found your phone.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Phoebe! You can’t do th…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Shhh! I’m on a call! Umm well yeah, you can pick it up tonight, say 8:30? At-at my apartment. It’s umm, it’s umm 5 Morton Street, Apartment 14, umm and then maybe y’know after we can grab a bite to eat or whatever. Okay, well okay I’ll see you then. Bye.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You do know that I will be here when he comes over.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh? And how will you know what time to come over?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You just said it!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh. Okay, well I-I was kinda hoping that I would just…be alone y’know to think about my mom and her suicide.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh Phoebe!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What?! That’s the first time today!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So you like the nachos uh? Myself I’m partial to…

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: See you in 2003.

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: You’re absolutely right they are writing me out of the show. They don’t know exactly when it’s going to happen, but apparently going to be very soon and that’s it.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I’m so sorry. Look, if it was up to me you would never leave the show.

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: Yeah, thanks.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No I mean it! I can’t believe they would do this to you! And to your fans! I mean they are going to be devastated! Heart broken! They love you so much!

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: Oh you’re right. Thank you! What’s your name again?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Joey.

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: Joey, well thank you. That is so sweet. Oh, excuse me.

utterance.speaker: The Writer
utterance.content: It wasn’t my decision!

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: I’m having a conversation here! You were saying?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Uh yeah-ye-ye-ye-ye-ye—l-l-l-l-l-look the-the-the only reason that I, that I came up to you before was because well, I’m really nervous about-about being you. Y’know if you can help me capture the essence of the character. Y’know? Help me keep Jessica alive. Please?

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: All right Joey, I will help you. Not because I-I owe it to this stupid show, but because I owe it to Jessica.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh that’s great! Oh thank you so much!

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: You’re so welcome.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey! Now, I’ve been watching some tapes, how’s this? "Jessica Lockhart will never step foot in this place again! Ever!!"

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: Is that supposed to be me?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: Yeah but Jessica doesn’t have an English accent.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I can do an English accent?! That baby’s going on my resume!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, I feel like a snack!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Do you want some shortbread? Eh that’s Scottish like you are.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh no thanks. I don’t like any thing from my Scottish heritage.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well it’s just my entire family was run out of Scotland by…Vikings. Anyway, lots of bad memories.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh well, it sounds to me like your family is ready to uh, rediscover its Scottish roots.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No! No-no they’re not. They’re still very angry! But y’know Chandler is also half-Swedish. You know what the Swedish people are famous for? Sitting down and being quiet.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well yeah-yeah the Scottish history is so much more…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You can not play bagpipes at the wedding!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: How did you know about that?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: We heard you play all the way from your apartment!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Were you the ones called the cops?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That’s not really important right now. What is important is; while we appreciate the gesture, we just don’t feel bagpipes are appropriate for our wedding.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Because we hate them.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Come on that’s not fair! I mean you haven’t even heard me play!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: We have heard you play.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, you’ve heard my practice. Okay? Just-just give me a chance to perform for you and then decide whatever you want. And I’m not going to tell you what song I’m gonna play either. But uh, let’s just say when it’s over I’ll bet there will be a we bit o’ celebration.

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: So, the essence of the character is rooted in her confidence. So, when Jessica enters a room for instance, she owns everything and every person in that room. You try.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay! All right!

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: No, he already knows that he owns everything in the room! He’s not finding it out for the first time! So, try it again.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay. Okay.

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: Right. He’s not angry at the room either. Try it again, he owns it! He owns the room. It is his. He owns, owns, owns, owns the room! He owns it!! All right, it’s a little weird, but it’s getting better. Oh well, I’m gonna miss this woman so much. I don’t know what I’m going to do! I mean, it’s been 20 years of my life.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh well—Hey-hey! Maybe, maybe uh, maybe this is a good thing. Y’know? It’ll-it’ll give you a chance to shake things up, play different characters. You’re so talented.

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: I am. I am, but I don’t know you know. An actor of a certain age is not that easy.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey that’s not true! Look at uh, look at Angela Lansb—Angelina Jolie!

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: I probably should’ve just left years ago when the offers were pouring in, but y’know I just got so comfy here! And… Ohh, I turned down some amazing work!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Like-like what?

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: Well, let’s just say if I left 15 years ago, the landscape of Mexican cinema would be very different today!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Wow!

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: But… Well now, now’s a different time for me.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh hey come on, don’t-don’t-don’t do this! Umm, look let-let me tell you something, okay? Now when I watch you do a scene, I’m thinking, "Boy, she-she is a great actress!" Uh but-but, I am also thinking, "She is hot!"

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: You think I’m hot?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You own the room. We should probably get-get uh…

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: Oh yeah-yeah, we should get the… So when Jessica kisses a man, she usually puts umm, both her hands on the man’s face.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah-yeah, I noticed that! Is that ‘cause she’s so passionate?

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: No! It’s because that way the camera only sees her! Do you wanna try it?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah! Okay.

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: That was good, that was really good. But I-I think your hands maybe a little off, they should be maybe right like…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey! Hey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe and Rachel
utterance.content: Who is it?

utterance.speaker: Guy
utterance.content: Hi! It’s Tom, I’m here to pick up the phone.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Whoa! Why do you get to answer the door?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well why shouldn’t I?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Because it’s my apartment!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, then I get to give him the cell phone.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay. All right. Good luck explaining all the calls to China.

utterance.speaker: Tom
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wow! How long were we arguing for?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You’re not the man who left the cell phone.

utterance.speaker: Tom
utterance.content: No that’s my assistant.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Is-is he coming?

utterance.speaker: Tom
utterance.content: Umm, no.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Could you-could you umm, give us one second?

utterance.speaker: Tom
utterance.content: Sure!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: We’ll be right back sir.

utterance.speaker: Tom
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wh-what do we do?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I don’t know!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Can you believe this? We were waiting for a hot guy and then an even hotter one shows up!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I know! What?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hmm, they just don’t make ‘em like that anymore!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No-no they do but, you just have to wait.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Rachel, listen—I mean, if you let me have him then I will really owe you one.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right. All right Phoebe I will let you have him, but you owe me; you owe me big!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah! You’re such a great friend!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh…

utterance.speaker: Tom
utterance.content: So, which one of you lovely ladies am I going to take to dinner huh?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh that’d be me. Sir. After you.

utterance.speaker: Tom
utterance.content: Okay. Okay.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Nice!

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: Well, you certainly own that room.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Actually I rent the whole place and, I just got what you meant. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my God! Oh my God!! Ohh, Jessica Lockhart!! In my apartment!! I am such a huge fan! I am such a huge fan!

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: Well, it’s nice to know that you…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: MONICA!!!! MONICA!!!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That uh, that is my roommate Rachel.

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: Oh that explains all the women’s underwear.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Sure. Yep.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God! It’s true!! Oh my God you are so amazing! Oh my God, can I just ask you to do me oh, just one favor?

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: Certainly.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Would you slap me? Would you slap me right here in the face?!

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: I’d love to, but my lawyer said I can’t do that anymore.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: God. You seem really, really nice.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, bye-bye.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I mean n-not-not fake at all like most famous people.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right, here we go.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh wait, just one more thing! One more minute! Umm, you’re a stupid bitch.

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: I really can’t slap you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You are so beautiful.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Nice to meet you! My God you’re great!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Thanks for stopping by. See ya! I-I am so sorry. I…

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: Oh no-no-no-no, being adored. I’m used to it, don’t worry about it.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: They sent me today’s script! They never send the script!

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: They don’t?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well no, I’m just in a coma. This must mean I have lines! Oh…

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: How does it happen?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ew, you get thrown from a horse into an electric fence.

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: Ah what?! Jessica hates horses!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah well, I’m guessing after this she’s not going to be crazy about electricity either.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: …now remember you have to imagine me in a kilt.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I can imagine you in a short plaid skirt and knee socks.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Do you wanna start telling secrets?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Now umm, remember I’m still learning.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: One, two, three, four!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You know the song! Sing along!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: Monica and Chandler
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Dina
utterance.content: Loosening the saddle on mother’s horse was brilliant Fredrick. And the electric fence, inspired.

utterance.speaker: Fredrick
utterance.content: Thank you sweetheart.

utterance.speaker: Dina
utterance.content: I can’t believe she’s really gone. Look around you, all of this is ours.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I don’t think so.

utterance.speaker: Dina
utterance.content: Who are you?!

utterance.speaker: Jessica Lockhart
utterance.content: What’s the matter Dina? Don’t you recognize your own mother?!

utterance.speaker: The Director
utterance.content: Cut! That was great everybody! Thank you!

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: That was so wonderful! Ohh, I think that you’re a better Jessica than I ever was!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh noo…

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: Well of course not, but you were very good.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Thanks!

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: And guess what? Good news! I got another job!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Great! Hey! All right! Well-well what is it?!

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: A film in Guadalajara!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: The airport?

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: No that’s La Guardia. This is Mexico.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ohh. Wow! Well how-how, how will you be gone?

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: Eight months.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That’s a really long time.

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: Yeah, but you can come and visit me. I bet that you could uh, own a few places down there.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well I tell ya, I should probably buy a place in the city first. And I just got what you meant again—That is—I tell ya, that is a tricky one!

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: That is a tricky one. Well, Joey I really wanna thank you. You’ve, well you made a very difficult time for me a little less painful.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Good luck.

utterance.speaker: Cecilia
utterance.content: You too.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You know the song! Sing along!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Eeee!!! Eee!! Eee!!

utterance.speaker: Matthew Perry
utterance.content: Eee!!

utterance.speaker: Lisa Kudrow
utterance.content: Do it again!
